verb.description: (especially of an official body) absolve (someone) from blame for a fault or wrongdoing, especially after due consideration of the case.
examples: they should exonerate these men from this crime

verb.description: Release someone from (a duty or obligation).

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin exonerat- freed from a burden, from the verb exonerare, from ex- from + onus, oner- a burden.
